de.susebox.jtopas.spi
Interface DataProvider

All Known Implementing Classes:
TestMultithreadTokenizerProperties, TestTokenizerProperties
public interface DataProvider

This interface supplies the nessecary methods for a DataMapper or its subinterfaces (WhitespaceHandler, SeparatorHandler, PatternHandler KeywordHandler and SequenceHandler) to perform its operations like checking for whitespaces, special sequences etc. Instances of the interface are created by Tokenizer implementations.

A Tokenizer implementation will either implement the DataProvider interface itself or has an associated - probably non-public - implementing class.

Each implementation of this interface should also override the method Object.toString().

Author:
Heiko Blau
See Also:
Tokenizer, TokenizerProperties, DataMapper

Method Detail

getData

public char[] getData()
This method retrieves the data range the active DataMapper should use for its operations. The calling method of the DataMapper should be aware that the provided array is probably the input buffer of the Tokenizer. It should therefore treat it as a read-only object.
Use this method in combination with getStartPosition() and getLength(). Characters outside this range are invalid.
For a more secure but slower access, use the method getDataCopy() to retrieve a copy of the valid character range.

Returns:
the character buffer to read data from

getDataCopy

public char[] getDataCopy()
This method copies the current data range of the Tokenizer providing the DataProvider into a character buffer. Use this method if data should be modified.
The copy contains only valid data starting at position 0 with the length of the array returned. Don't use getStartPosition() or getLength() on this copy.
An alternative to this method is Object.toString() which should therefore be overridden in implementations of this interface.

Returns:
a copy of the valid data of this DataProvider
See Also:
getData()

getStartPosition

public int getStartPosition()
Retrieving the position where the data to analyze start in the buffer provided by getData(). The calling DataMapper must not access data prior to this index in the character array.

Returns:
index in the character array returned by getData(), where data starts

getLength

public int getLength()
Retrieving the maximum number of characters in the array provided by getData() that can be analyzed by the calling DataMapper.

Returns:
true if the given character is a separator, false otherwise
